News

Developing a library arts programme with young people, library staff and artists

Written by Melissa Matthews · Published Jul 31, 2018

Arts programme coordinator Melissa Matthews talks about the next big step in the development of the Suffolk Libraries Arts Programme.

Suffolk Libraries launches new service giving free access to newspapers and magazines

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 27, 2018

Suffolk Libraries has launched an exciting new eLibrary service giving anyone with a library card free online access to a wide range of top newspaper and magazine titles from around the world.

New library telephone numbers

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 24, 2018

Several of our libraries have recently changed their telephone numbers.

Move it! Sports equipment now on offer from six Suffolk Libraries

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 21, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is doing its bit to make Suffolk the most active county, with six libraries now offering a range of sports equipment for customers to borrow.

Suffolk Libraries marks the increasing popularity of eLibrary services

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 6, 2018

Over half a million items have now been borrowed from our eLibrary. In 2017/18, our customers borrowed nearly 107,000 eBooks and 29,000 eAudiobooks from OverDrive and BorrowBox, downloaded 24,000 eMagazines from RBdigital, and 52,000 songs from Freegal. They also streamed 109,000 songs from Freegal.

Bungay Library to temporarily close for refurbishment in July

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 5, 2018

Bungay Library will be closed from Tuesday 10 - Wednesday 18 July for refurbishment and redecoration. It will reopen at the usual time of 9am on Thursday 19 July.

Beccles Library to temporarily close for refurbishment in June

Written by James Powell · Published May 18, 2018

Beccles Library will be closing for one week in June for refurbishment and improvements.

Thurston student wins 23rd Book Mastermind

Written by James Powell · Published May 9, 2018

Katy Shaw from Thurston Community College is the winner of Suffolk Libraries’ Book Mastermind competition 2018.

Suffolk Libraries Extra supporters' scheme funds exciting new projects

Written by James Powell · Published Apr 16, 2018

Several library projects have recently received funding from Suffolk Libraries Extra, the supporters' fundraising scheme we launched last year.

Suffolk Libraries is now a National Portfolio Organisation

Written by James Powell · Published Apr 6, 2018

As of 1 April 2018, we have official National Portfolio Status from the Arts Council.
